website_summaries.verdict: An affordable brewer for solo coffee drinkers or those who like to take their beverages to go.
pros: Comes with an 18-ounce travel mug that keeps coffee hot
Brews quickly and is compact enough to fit even in small kitchens
Runs quietly and makes delicious java
cons: Various user reports of defective units
Some buyers may be concerned that this is a refurbished coffee maker

customer_reviews.title: Love my Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I have limited counter space, so this is perfect... the only thing is my outlets are on the other side of the wall, I drag the coffee maker to the other side, I have made it easier to drag by putting a cloth under coffee maker to slide it across the counter instead of picking up, since it has rubber underneath it.. it makes the perfect cup of coffee for me and I can use any brand of coffee, instead of those pods....I am happy with it!!
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: Great Pour-over Substitute
customer_reviews.text: This is the best auto coffee maker I've used. I was a pour-over fan for a long time because I taste a clear difference in the coffee-brewing methods; pour overs are much smoother and do not have a metallic taste that I suspect comes from the way most coffee makers super-heat the water. I also like that it does not have a heater for the carafe so the coffee can begin to cool as soon as it's brewed and I can drink it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Tom O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste time or money with Kitchen Aid Coffee Makers!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Electrical System broke after the second day of use.. This was the second Kitchen Aid Coffee maker I bought for my Dad for Christmas after the first miserably failed too and the second one that copped out on the electrical system. Maybe it's time to source better circuit boards and ensure Quality on the coffee makers too. I was not impressed, bought my Dad a completely different coffee maker which has been a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary E Cox

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I loved this coffee maker but it died out of nowhere on me, completely stopped working. The mug that comes with it sucks. The machine itself could be taller to accommodate taller travel coffee mugs, you're really limited to size and style of travel mug. Overall disappointed with this product. Wish it didnt die within 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Blazier

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: I had to research to find an alternative for my unreliable Keurig Vue V500. This KitchenAid is perfect. I wanted to brew a thermo mug 16-18 oz. The fill hole is relatively small, and the volume marks are hard to see be cause of the dark tint. Solution: fill with a 2 cup measuring cup! Solved.

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee IMHO ever
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Perfect combination of brew time, water spraying and water temperature to produce fully balanced cup. Crisp top notes followed by lingering base notes. I find myself stopping what I am doing after taking a sip just to enjoy the aftertaste in the back of the mouth . I use Mayorga Cubano and Iit tastes exactly like I ate a piece of very dark very good chocolate. After a couple of years the off/on switch is flaky and I tried the Bonavita 5 cup brewer. NO comparision. Returned the Bonavita after a couple of days. Coffee tasted flat. Keeping the Kitchenaid and will buy another if and switch crps out.
customer_reviews.author: Cincinnatus

I disposed of the broken one and now, I get nothing because I cannot ship it back. Poor quality, and poor service that I did not expect from a good brand like this.

The hotel coffee maker is too small. The cheap coffer maker doesn't make good coffee at all. This Kitchen Aid is perfect. Nice hot coffee. Another feature I like is no wasted plastic cups. I use Folgers Classic coffee and some flavored coffees too. If I

The lid on the mug is also not the best for drinking your morning injection of life. The lip on the front poorly done. I get the fact it is there to reduce splashing from the brew process, however, it enables liquid to escape from the side of the raised lip and then run down your face. The rim should be the same height all the way around to prevent the loss of valuable nitrous to your day.
